snippet: No one denies that Horace Kelly is deeply disturbed.    He often sits in his own waste in his cell on California's death row and goes long stretches without combing his hair or bathing....
lead_paragraph: No one denies that Horace Kelly is deeply disturbed. He often sits in his own waste in his cell on California's death row and goes long stretches without combing his hair or bathing.
abstract: California is holding special competency trial to decide whether Horace Kelley, who is scheduled to be executed for killing two women and 11-year-old boy in 1984, has become too incompetent during years on death row to be put to death; mental competency threshold that inmate must meet before being wheeled into death chamber is so low that capital punishment experts recall only three or four cases of execution being stopped because hearing concluded that condemned man had grown too imcompetent; photo (M)

headline.main: Jury to Decide if Condemned Man Comprehends His Fate
